trans-unit.source: Issuer Name and Issuer Key in BizTalk Services | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Issuer Name and Issuer Key in BizTalk Services | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to retrieve Issuer Name and Issuer Key for either Service Bus or Access Control (ACS) in BizTalk Services. MABS, WABS
trans-unit.target: Learn how to retrieve Issuer Name and Issuer Key for either Service Bus or Access Control (ACS) in BizTalk Services. MABS, WABS

trans-unit.source: Azure BizTalk Services uses the Service Bus Issuer Name and Issuer Key, and the Access Control Issuer Name and Issuer Key.
trans-unit.target: Azure BizTalk Services uses the Service Bus Issuer Name and Issuer Key, and the Access Control Issuer Name and Issuer Key.

trans-unit.target: Specifically:

trans-unit.target: Task

trans-unit.source: Service Bus Issuer Name and Issuer Key
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Issuer Name and Issuer Key

trans-unit.source: This topic lists the steps to retrieve the Issuer Name and Issuer Key.
trans-unit.target: This topic lists the steps to retrieve the Issuer Name and Issuer Key.

trans-unit.source: The Access Control Issuer Name and Issuer Key are used by the following:
trans-unit.target: The Access Control Issuer Name and Issuer Key are used by the following:

trans-unit.source: Your Azure BizTalk Service application created in Visual Studio: To successfully deploy your BizTalk Service application in Visual Studio to Azure, you enter the Access Control Issuer Name and Issuer Key.
trans-unit.target: Your Azure BizTalk Service application created in Visual Studio: To successfully deploy your BizTalk Service application in Visual Studio to Azure, you enter the Access Control Issuer Name and Issuer Key.

trans-unit.source: The Azure BizTalk Services Portal: When you create a BizTalk Service and open the BizTalk Services Portal, your Access Control Issuer Name and Issuer Key are automatically registered for your deployments with the same Access Control values.
trans-unit.target: The Azure BizTalk Services Portal: When you create a BizTalk Service and open the BizTalk Services Portal, your Access Control Issuer Name and Issuer Key are automatically registered for your deployments with the same Access Control values.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, select BizTalk Services.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, select BizTalk Services.

trans-unit.source: Select your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Select your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Select Connection Information in the task bar.
trans-unit.target: Select Connection Information in the task bar.

trans-unit.source: The Access Control Namespace, Default Issuer (Issuer Name), and Default Key (Issuer Key) are listed and can be copied and pasted.
trans-unit.target: The Access Control Namespace, Default Issuer (Issuer Name), and Default Key (Issuer Key) are listed and can be copied and pasted.

trans-unit.source: To summarize: Issuer Name = Default Issuer Issuer Key = Default Key
trans-unit.target: To summarize: Issuer Name = Default Issuer Issuer Key = Default Key

trans-unit.source: You can also select Open ACS Management Portal to get the Access Control values:
trans-unit.target: You can also select Open ACS Management Portal to get the Access Control values:

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, select BizTalk Services.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, select BizTalk Services.

trans-unit.source: Select your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Select your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Select the Connection Information button and select Open ACS Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Select the Connection Information button and select Open ACS Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: In the Portal under Service Settings, select Service Identities.
trans-unit.target: In the Portal under Service Settings, select Service Identities.

trans-unit.source: This displays your Service Identity, which is your Access Control Issuer Name value.
trans-unit.target: This displays your Service Identity, which is your Access Control Issuer Name value.

trans-unit.source: Select your Service Identity link to see the Password, which is your Issuer Key value.
trans-unit.target: Select your Service Identity link to see the Password, which is your Issuer Key value.

trans-unit.source:
Their values can be copied.

For example, in Service Identities, you see "owner".
trans-unit.target:
Their values can be copied.

For example, in Service Identities, you see "owner".

trans-unit.source: "Owner" is your Access Control Issuer Name.
trans-unit.target: "Owner" is your Access Control Issuer Name.

trans-unit.source: When you click the "owner" link, you see the Password.
trans-unit.target: When you click the "owner" link, you see the Password.

trans-unit.source: When you click the "Password" link, you see the value.
trans-unit.target: When you click the "Password" link, you see the value.

trans-unit.source: This Password value is your Access Control Issuer Key.
trans-unit.target: This Password value is your Access Control Issuer Key.

trans-unit.source: To summarize: Issuer Name = Service Identity name Issuer Key = Password value
trans-unit.target: To summarize: Issuer Name = Service Identity name Issuer Key = Password value

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, you can also select Active Directory to retrieve the Access Control values.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, you can also select Active Directory to retrieve the Access Control values.

trans-unit.source: When an Access Control Namespace is created using Active Directory, a Service Identity is not automatically created.
trans-unit.target: When an Access Control Namespace is created using Active Directory, a Service Identity is not automatically created.

trans-unit.source:
When you provision a BizTalk Service, an Access Control Namespace, Service Identity named "owner" (Issuer Name), Password (Issuer Key), and Symmetric Key are automatically created.
How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure Service Identities provides more information on Access Control Service Identities.
trans-unit.target:
When you provision a BizTalk Service, an Access Control Namespace, Service Identity named "owner" (Issuer Name), Password (Issuer Key), and Symmetric Key are automatically created.
How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure Service Identities provides more information on Access Control Service Identities.

trans-unit.source: Service Bus Issuer Name and Issuer Key are used by BizTalk Adapter Services.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Issuer Name and Issuer Key are used by BizTalk Adapter Services.

trans-unit.source: In your BizTalk Services project in Visual Studio, you use the BizTalk Adapter Services to connect to an on-premises Line-of-Business (LOB) system.
trans-unit.target: In your BizTalk Services project in Visual Studio, you use the BizTalk Adapter Services to connect to an on-premises Line-of-Business (LOB) system.

trans-unit.source: To connect, you create the LOB Relay and enter your LOB system details.
trans-unit.target: To connect, you create the LOB Relay and enter your LOB system details.

trans-unit.source: When doing this, you also enter the Service Bus Issuer Name and Issuer Key.
trans-unit.target: When doing this, you also enter the Service Bus Issuer Name and Issuer Key.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, select Service Bus.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, select Service Bus.

trans-unit.source: Select your namespace.
trans-unit.target: Select your namespace.

trans-unit.source: In the task bar, select Connection Information.
trans-unit.target: In the task bar, select Connection Information.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Default Issuer (Issuer Name) and Default Key (Issuer Key).
trans-unit.target: This displays the Default Issuer (Issuer Name) and Default Key (Issuer Key).

trans-unit.source: Their values can be copied.
trans-unit.target: Their values can be copied.

trans-unit.source: To summarize: Issuer Name = Default Issuer Issuer Key = Default Key
trans-unit.target: To summarize: Issuer Name = Default Issuer Issuer Key = Default Key
